content: Why was this accepted? I've been reading the statement for 5 minutes and I still haven't understood what to do.

Please update the test cases so that they test the same concept as the validators. For example, if a validator is checking if the current rank is >N, the associated test should also test that same scenario.  

If someone is not hardcoding their solution, they shouldn't be able to pass 100% of the tests, but fail the validators. I passed 100% of the tests, but failed the final validator.

Ideally you should have a test/validator for each of the following scenarios to properly test the "miscounted" scenarios: 
rank == N + 1
rank > N + 1
rank == 0
rank < 0
Hi ! First time commenting on a contribution. It's good, the example could be more explicit (all inputs are at 0) to make it more understandable.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good clash ;)

I think this clash concept has potential … but after re-reading several times I still don’t really understand.

Why are there multiple lines to show who out-run Marco ?

Update: ok I get it.  It’s who outran him each minute.  Can you make that clearer, and have a better example than one that is really an edge-case

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: it is bad from the formulating way ,  words and also the idea is repeated

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clear description of the puzzle.

Hi, looks good. May I suggest a few changes?

- "number of runner who outran Marcos" instead of "number of runner who outrunned Marcos".

- "Line" instead of "Ligne".

- "number of runner who was outrun by Marcos" instead of "number of runner who got outrunned by Marcos".

Just a few grammatical errors.
Other than that, very good looking clash.

Happy Coding, Code-Parser.

Goal
* Please change "In case" to "As".

* Please change "there is" to "there are".

* Please change "too many runner" to "too many runners".

* Please change "number of runner" to "number of runners".

* Please change "outrunned" to "outrun" (2 times).

* Please change "in a space of 1 minutes" to "at the frequency of 1 reading per minute until the end of the race".

Input
* Please change "Ligne" to "Line" (3 times).

* Please add "An integer" before "N", "rankinit" and "time".

* Line 1: Please change "runner" to "runners".

* Line 3: Please change "durated" to "duration".

* Line 3: Please change "minute" to "minutes".

* Please change "Next ligne" to "Next [[time]] lines".

* Please change "[[X Y]]" to "[[X]] [[Y]]".

* Please change "X is" to "[[X]] is".

* Please change "Y the" to "[[Y]] the".

* Please change "runner" to "runners" (2 times).

* Please change "outrunned" to "outrun" (2 times).

Output
* Please remove the quotation marks around "I miscounted..."

Constraints
* Please add the constraints on rankinit, X and Y.

Cases
* Please revise "Footing" validator so that it is similar to "Footing" test and is NOT a case of "I miscounted...".

* Please revise "National race" test so that it is similar to "National race" validator and IS a case of "I miscounted...".

Thanks.

Thank you for making some changes. Below are my comments on the current version:

Goal
* Please change "was outrun" to "were outrun".

* Please change "who outrun" to "who outran".

(Credits to @Code-Parser for the suggestions better than mine.)

Input
* (same changes as the two above)

Constraints
* Please format "rankinit", "x" and "y" as [[variables]].

* Please change the last "<" to "≤".

Cases
* Please change Footing validator so that it is different from Footing test (e.g. [[time]] is smaller than 10).

Thanks again.
